node.title: Bookstores facing supply chain crisis ahead of Christmas rush
node.alt: Photo shows bookshelves full of colourful books
node.description: Australia's independent bookstores are facing a critical supply crunch heading into their busiest period, with smaller booksellers worried they will not have copies of in-demand titles ahead of Christmas.
node.content:
["Australia's independent bookstores are facing a critical supply crunch heading into their busiest period, with smaller booksellers worried they won't have copies of in-demand titles ahead of Christmas.", "Industry insiders have described the situation as unprecedented, with bookstores waiting weeks for deliveries that normally take days, or getting just fractions of the books they have ordered.", "\"It is a crisis. I don't mind using that word,\" said Chris Redfern, who owns three Avenue Bookstores in Melbourne.", "\"The book industry has never found it so tough as the last few months,\" agrees Duncan Johnson, owner of the Hill of Content bookshops in Sydney and Melbourne, and CEO and franchisor of nationwide Collins Booksellers.", "
Demand surges
", "Like many retailers, booksellers have seen a surge in demand over the last few months, especially as Sydney and Melbourne have opened up.", "But the Australian book industry's supply model is highly unusual \u2013 all three of the major book distributors, which are owned by the major publishing houses, use the same logistics company, Brisbane-based XL Express, to transport books to customers.", "Faced with the unprecedented demand, XL Express has not been able to meet its deliveries on time, with smaller bookstores on the east coast left waiting weeks for key titles.", "\"It is unprecedented the volume of orders flowing through the system, and the capacity of the contractor to deliver is just not sufficient,\" said Robbie Egan, CEO of the Australian Booksellers Association.", "\"You've got all your eggs in one basket, and that distributor has been overwhelmed with the demand from bookshops coming out of the pandemic,\" said Nick Croydon, CEO of QBD Books.", "
All publishers affected\u00a0
", "On Monday, major publisher Hachette sent a letter to booksellers telling them XL Express had advised Hachette it would not be accepting any more deliveries from the major three distributors into their Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne depots while XL dealt with the backlog.", "\"XL have advised that it will take at least a week for the backlog to be cleared, but we do not believe it is sensible to commit to any rough timeline for when deliveries can resume yet,\" the letter said.", "In a statement to the ABC XL Express MD Colin Mallory defended his company saying record sales and the pressures of the pandemic on staffing and equipment shortages, \"adds up to delivery delays for us and other partners as we work feverishly to ... catch up to the current volumes.\"", "Mr Mallory said the company had been able to add staff and capacity but \"have to do so safely.\"", "\"Assuming the overseas issues resolve our aim is to have our retailers well-supplied as soon as possible and in time for Christmas,\" he added.\u00a0", "
Smaller book stores most affected\u00a0
", "Christmas is traditionally the busiest time of the year for booksellers, and publishers save their top titles to come out at this time.", "This year, new offerings from Trent Dalton, Hannah Kent, Lee Child and Will Smith are all jostling for shelf space.", "\"This is the time we are basically stocking up for Christmas,\" says Chris Redfern of Avenue Bookstores.", "\"All the big new releases are coming out and we are getting a tiny per cent of what we have ordered.\"", "", "
Chris Redfern says Avenue Bookstores are getting a tiny percentage of the stock they have ordered.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "Mark Rubbo, CEO of Readings bookshops, said he was concerned by the supply chain crunch because the literary ecosystem is so reliant on Christmas.", "\"It's not just booksellers who rely on this. It's authors and smaller publishers who rely on the Christmas trade to get them through until next year,\" he said.", "Larger sellers such as QBD, which has 86 bookstores, said they are less affected because they have been able to organise alternative deliveries direct from publishers.", "CEO Nick Croydon said his stores are \"full of books\" although there are delays to online orders and to the supply system generally.", "", "
QBD says it has managed to find a workaround with suppliers thanks to its size.\u00a0(Lucas Hill: ABC News\u00a0)
", "Australia's largest bookseller, Booktopia, has its own large warehouse in Sydney and said it is not experiencing the same issues because it has been able to get supplies early and keep them on-premise, an option not available to smaller retailers.", "One major publisher, who wouldn't speak on the record, told the ABC the next three weeks would be critical to get the situation resolved.", "Hachette CEO Louise Stark told the ABC the delays are being felt by all industries and \"are not unique to one distributor or carrier,\" and the company worked with booksellers in advance to prepare.", "\"Readers are going to be spoilt for choice, with an amazing line-up from across our vibrant publishing industry,\" she said.", "", "
Industrial action and pent-up demand threaten supply chains.
", "
Silver linings
", "While acknowledging the difficulties, the Australian Booksellers Association, which represents many smaller booksellers, said the upside is that it represents strong demand.", "\"I've had indications that volumes are up about 70 per cent on last year, and last year had very high volumes already,\" said CEO Robbie Egan.", "Smaller booksellers have praised publishing houses for good communication and making big efforts to find alternative ways to meet demand.", "While XL Express works its way through the bottlenecks to hopefully be able to meet orders again soon, QBD's Nick Croydon has one piece of advice for readers looking for literary gifts this year."]
